result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

11:30 AM Prosecuting attorney Zachary Wittchow in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Kyle P Cannon in court.  Attorney Annette E Rauch in court for Kyle P Cannon. File not called on the record. Defense requests matter be set for trial.  Jury trial expected to last 2-3 days.  Court will select an alternate juror.  Each side to receive 5 strikes. 7/8/22:  Court ordered the no contact order modified to no violent contact with Victim A.  GPS monitoring can be removed.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no violent contact with Victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant to have no contact with witness A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant to turn over any weapons to the Waukesha County Sheriff's Department.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant to report to WCS the first business day after their release from custody.  If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes.  Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms.

09:32 AM Defendant Kyle P Cannon in court with attorney Annette E Rauch.  Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case called for motion to modify bail.
Arguments by defense.
Statement by Victim A.
Statement by defendant.
For the reasons stated on the record the Court grants the motion and orders the no contact order modified to no violent contact as to Victim A.  GPS monitoring can be removed.  Court will maintain the no contact order with Witness A.
Defense is waiting for electronic discovery.
Court will remove the 7/13/22 hearing date and reschedule in about 30 days.  Hearing scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Bail/bond hearing on July 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Motion to Modify Bond, filed by Atty. Rauch.

Hearing on April 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with victim A/witness A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant to comply with GPS monitoring through Wisconsin Community Services.  Defendant is not to come within 1 mile of Victim A, listed in the Victim Identification Key, or their residence, employment, school or anywhere they frequent.  Defendant to turn over any weapons to the Waukesha County Sheriff's Department.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant to report to WCS the first business day after their release from custody.  If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes.  Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms.

02:56 PM Defendant Kyle P Cannon in court, in custody, with attorney Steven Hughes, as a friend of the court.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for April 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.
